issue.description: Annex C Figure C.1 ed Measure_representation_arm doesn't use Geometric_tolerance_arm. Remove the connection.
4.3.4 Compound_datum It is recommended not to use the plural in this way: "...set of two or more Single_datums..." We recommend to write "...set of two or more Single_datum instances/objects..."
4.3.7 Datum attribute definition It is recommended not to include the word in its own definition.

4.3.8 Datum_target example It is recommended not to use the plural in this way: "...establishing a Datum_target_set of two Datum_targets,..." We recommend to write "...establishing a Datum_target_set of two Datum_target objects/instances,..."
4.3.11 Geometric_tolerance examples The examples are not numbered.
4.3.12 Geometric_tolerance_relationship notes The numbering of the notes is incorrect.

4.3.32 Tolerance_zone_definition attribute descriptions Wrong definition: first_element: the Tolerance_zone that is specified by the Tolerance_zone_definition. Change by: first_element: the Shape_element that represents the first bounding element.

SC 4 shall not redefine concepts on geometrical product specification and tolerancing since they are already defined in ISO TC 213. Two examples:- Subclause 4.3.7 gives the definition of a "datum" which is different from the one of ISO 5459:1981 and also different from the one of ISO/DIS 5459-1:2002.- Subclause 4.3.4 defines a "compound_datum" which seems to correspond to a "common datum" in ISO 5459:1981 and ISO/DIS 5459-1:2002. A note has been added "A compound datum is in some tolerancing standards called a multiple datum feature or a common datum". SC 4 and ISO/TC 213 should work together to identify the discrepancies.

4.3.32 Tolerance_zone_definition attribute descriptions Wrong definition: first_element: the Tolerance_zone that is specified by the Tolerance_zone_definition. Change by: first_element: the Shape_element that represents the first bounding element.

It is not clear how to specify what standard is to be used to interpret the instances or dimensions and tolerances found in a schema instance (NOTE this may belong in AP203e2 instead of a module) Create an arm entity GDT_specification, that is a specialization of Document, and assign it to Product_view_defintion, or Item_shapeOrDocument in the GDT usage guide how this is to be done with existing constructs.
Does not specify how to encode taper ratios Document, possibly as ratio units

Does not specify how to do bi-directional tolerancing. Feature location dimension system is (#3 rectangular) (#4 polar) Model with two geometric tolerances, which are reach related to separate location dimensions, using a part 47 shape dimension_related_tolerance_zone_element Measurement path must be specified for the dimensions. Perhaps additionally, a geometric_tolerance_relationship could be used between the geometric tolerances Either rectangular or polar coordinates must be supported.
No association of material modifier to a sizing tolerance for form tolerances

No way is provided to associate qualifiers to dimensions values Examples: free_state, average Add constructs similar to GEOMETRIC_TOLERANCE_QUALIFIER(ref AP210),, etc or give examples of using qualifiers, (possibly in AP203e2 ) This will require a new USE FROM Extended_measure_representation, or a new module Extended_gdt

No way is provided to associate qualifiers to tolerance values. not_convex, not_concave, free_state, each_element, each_radial_element, major_diameter, minor_diameter, pitch_diameter. Add constructs similar to TOLERANCE _QUALIFIER (ref AP210), etc or give examples of using qualifiers, (possibly in AP203e2 )
No way is documented to specify a statistical tolerance and alternate tolerance for geometric tolerance

No support for new modifier "U" for profile tolerances, that indicates the tolerance zone is unequally disposed about the profile, and allows for an offset value. This is preferred in some practices over the dimensioning of the tolerance zone. Add support for this concept.

BAE SYSTEMS has its own internal standards on tolerances, generally based on external standards such as BS8888. The propsed module will not be interpreted consistently unless it references an appropriate standard for Geometric Tolerancing. Observations marked MjT (Major Technical) may in fact be issues in the context of a particular tolerancing standard. It is therfore recommended that this module be REJECTED.

description.p: Agree this is needed. Not sure where is best place to put it. Probably high up the USE FROM tree, because potentially an external standard could apply to almost anything in an AP203e32 schema instance. I am thinking of annotations particularly which are not there but may come.
The only STEP standard that addresses this is AP210 which has an ARM entity mapped in part:

"requirements_property document_assigned_item <- applied_document_reference.items[i] applied_document_reference document_reference.assigned_document -> ee_specification document <- document_relationship {document_relationship document_relationship.description = `required specification'} -> ee_specification" dimensioning standard to be used for the interpretation of the GDT requirements. EE_SPECIFICATION "ee_specification <= document

EXAMPLE : document_name = "Technical drawings -- Geometrical tolerancing -- (etc) " creation_date.year = 1995 , publisher = "ISO" base_identifier = Ee_document_identifier assigned_value = identifier_name = "document number".

issue.description: Introduction could be rather more helpful

comment.description: Agree. Have added a bit of material. More is probably needed.

issue.description: The scope is rather terse, particularly with respect to datum systems. It should be made clear if these are modelled only in respect of tolerances. The term "datum" is also uses to mean the origin of a local co-ordinate space

datum_representation_select The targets of the select include Shape_element and Derived_shape_element, which is a subtype of Shape_element. If there is a specific reason for doing this, then it should be mentioned in the definition otherwise it would be sufficient to only reference Shape_element and to add a note to the effect that this includes Derived_shape_element as a subtype

The definitions of tolerance are not given any context in which they can be uniquely interpeted. This is required. This should either be done by a reference (preferably to an ISO statndard) or by a full explanation with supporting examples

comment.description: Agree. See comment on UK19 Propose to provide a reference because of large user requirement for standards other than ISO, for example BAE Systems apparently does not use ISO 1101 :-).

issue.description: Many of the definitions use the phrase "sepecifies a requirement to control", which is confusing and should be made clear.

The cardinality of many of the reference_datum attributes is a set[1:2] (or [0:3]). Please check that this is a set of 1 or 2 elements (or 0, 1, 2, or 3), rather than an array, and that the order in which the datums are used is irrelevant. The descriptions are confusing, as they often refer to "the datum system that defines..." where in fact the cardinality does not specify a single datum.
The type of tolerance discussed may put a restriction on the subtype of datum which the tolerance is defined against.

Circular_runout_tolerance:angle The reference to the "datum axis" implies either that an axis is defined explicitly for the datum (which is not done) or that the type of datum used must have a unique axis (which requires a Where rule). This is also confusing, as two datums may be used.
Coaxiality_tolerance The note makes clear that this entity is ill-defined
Compound_datum The datum should have an attribute that describes how the various component datums are to be combined

ARM:Datum This definition precludes the use of the term datum in any other context. The entity should be renamed Tolerance_datum, with similar renaming applying to the other entities using the word "datum
Datum_target_set:rule_description "If present, there shall be exactly on object..." - what is the object referred to? This should be made clear.
Geometric_tolerance:WR2 If tolerance_value is to be a length measure, then how are angular_tolerances to be measured?
Geometric_tolerance tolerance_value The attribute implicitly references an external standard, but it is not explained how this standard should be referenced (e.g. by assigning a document_element).
Geometric_tolerance As there is more than one example, the examples should be numbered
Geometric_tolerance:value_determination This would be better as a classification in an External Class Library
Geometric_tolerance_relationship Check attribute order. Notes numbered out of sequence.

Placed_target The definition specifies that parameters are used, but the entity does not supply the parameters nor is any indication given showing where the parameters and their values are to be found.

comment.description: Added words to Placed_target description that it is one of its suptypes. Added words to parameter_references to say that the params are documented in the subtype.

issue.description: Projection The entity does not specify in which direction the project is made.

comment.description: The text specifies that the projection is external to the part. Clarified that the projection was from the shape_element projection_end . Added a note that the representation for one or both of the Shape_elements that define the tolerance zone may be included if necessary .
